tongue_twisters.content: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers.
She sells sea shells by the seashore.
How can a clam cram in a clean cream can?
I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream!
Fuzzy Wuzzy was a bear, Fuzzy Wuzzy had no hair.
A black bug bled black blood. What color blood did the black bug bleed?
How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?
Six slippery snails slid slowly seaward.
The great Greek grape growers grow great Greek grapes.

questions.content: What experiences in life have shaped your perspective the most?
How do you handle stress or pressure, especially when faced with challenging situations?
Describe a time when you took a risk and what you learned from it.
What role does creativity play in your life and how do you nurture it?
If you could change one thing about the world, what would it be and why?
How do you define success, and what steps do you take to achieve it?
Tell me about a time you had to learn something new within a short time. How did you handle it?
How have your goals and ambitions changed over the past five years?
What is the most valuable lesson you've learned from a mistake you made?
If you could meet any historical figure, who would it be and what would you ask them?
